availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Any reuse of the material should credit the Walt Whitman Archive. Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

notesStmt.note: Whitman's title on the recto of the first leaf suggests a likely date of 1863 for this manuscript. It is possible, however, that Whitman reused the first leaf of paper and that the apparent title is not connected to the rest of the manuscript.

div1.p: instruction—the gap at present impassable gulf between the body & th of men & the officers must be removed , entirely, (if it is necessary then I say our whole whole aAmerican theory is a big wind-bag, & stands no test worth mentioning)
confession to make that nowhe I have not found one who fully realized the truth, the —
I have not found such officers in any branch of the regular service, nor in the volunteers, nor in the hospitals
Maxim—Our military & naval service must be democratized—men must rise from the ranks by judicious promotions,—maymust be educated by a more new mixture of theoretical & practical
